segments.text: I see a woman standing by the sink, completely absorbed in drying a plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink is overflowing, and water is pouring onto the floor, but she doesn’t seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in the puddle, yet she keeps polishing that plate like nothing’s wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the children behind her, one climbing a wobbly stool to reach the cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretching so far, and the stool looks like it’s about to tip over.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is waiting with her hand out, ready to grab a cookie.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman is going to slip any second now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is spreading everywhere, and she’s just standing there, oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm she is while everything around her is falling apart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, but inside, it’s pure chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’ll ever notice what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR
